newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: FELS boosts stake in Keppel Engineering.
newsitem.headline: FELS boosts stake in Keppel Engineering.

text.p: Far East Levingston Shipbuilding, the rig-building unit of Keppel Corp, has raised its stake in Keppel Integrated Engineering to 20 percent, the Straits Times newspaper said on Tuesday.
It said FELS bought 13.3 million shares at Singapore 50 cents each in an off-market cross from sister company Singmarine Industries for S$19.3 million in cash.
The price paid for the Keppel Engineering stock was based on the average of the weighted average price shares for each of the five market days before Monday, it said.
Keppel Engineering's share price rose 13 cents to $1.57 by 0150 GMT on Tuesday after the news.
Dealers said the move was part of a streamlining of shipbuilding operations by Keppel Group.

In a separate move, the Straits Times said Keppel Engineering was selling its 25 percent interest in FELS China to FELS for S$5.2 million by the end of the year. FELS China would become a wholly-owned unit of FELS, it said.
